questionListItems.title: What’s the difference between OGP and Govtech?
questionListItems.body: I'm curious to know the difference between the two

answer.body:
OGP is formally (legally) part of the Government Technology Agency, but we practically function as a separate organisation.

We share a common mission with GovTech in that we’re building tech for public good.
However, we differ in that OGP has been set up since July 2019 to run separately from the rest of GovTech, so that we can take best practices from companies out there e.g. best tech and organisation practices from top tech companies, and apply them in the government domain to better deliver on tech for public good. OGP’s mission is threefold:

(1) Experiment on these best practices (from how we build tech products, the technologies we use, to how we run hiring, compensation, career tracks) in the public sector domain.
(2) Demonstrate what works in the public sector domain on projects and things which matter e.g. nationwide systems and products.
(3) Propagate these products and best practices to the rest of government, so that over time, we’re doing tech for public good well across the whole government.

OGP reports directly to GovTech and Smart Nation senior management, ie, our supervisory panel. We retain our own product ownership, run our own product teams, and have our own HR systems and practices.

questionListItems.title: What do you look out for when hiring new product managers?
questionListItems.body: I would like to find out more about the product manager role

answer.body:
In general, we look for people who show strong ability in the field they’re applying for, who care about tech for public good, who are strong communicators, and who take the initiative to make things happen.

We look more at demonstrated experience (e.g. side projects) than academic qualifications or specific degrees.

For product managers - we’re looking at candidates who show an entrepreneurial drive for public good.

An ideal candidate is one who shows tech know-how (understanding software engineering concepts, background in coding), good product sense in deriving product vision and road maps, and initiative.

questionListItems.title: What are the current working arrangements (wfh / in-office)?
questionListItems.body: Would like to know if OGP allows Work From Home or solely work from office?

answer.body:
We are flexible and leave this to the employee. We do not mandate a set number of days from home or from office. This flexibility is similar to how OGP functioned before COVID, where we believe we hire good people who will act responsibly, and do not clock-watch nor mandate where people work from.

We intend for work to always be hybrid in nature; OGP employees may be asked to come back for critical meetings e.g. regular team syncs, town halls, but generally we do not insist on this nor have fixed days or rosters

questionListItems.title: What kind of roles is OGP hiring for?
questionListItems.body: Also, how many roles is OGP looking to fill?

answer.body:
OGP is currently a team of 110, and we’re looking to hire 50 more people in the next 3-6 months.

We intend to scale to nearly 200 within 2023. We’re actively hiring for roles in all functions:

  • Product Management (Senior, Lead PMs; PM managers)

  • Software Engineering (Core, Senior, Lead SWEs, Eng Managers)

  • Product Design (Senior, Lead Designers, Design Managers),

  • Product Operations (Product Operations managers),

  • Policy Team

  • People Team (Hiring, People Operations).


We welcome applicants to any of these roles.

questionListItems.title: What’s the OGP interview process like?
questionListItems.body: Can I find out what the interview process is like?

answer.body:
Generally, our interview process starts with screening, followed by skills-based interviews, and a final interview with the hiring managers. You can view more here.


For PM roles:

  • CV Screening

  • Phone screen

  • Take-home assessment

  • Resume deep dive + case study interview

  • 1-hour interview with hiring managers


For Core/Senior/Lead SWE roles:

  • CV Screening

  • Online coding assessment

  • 2 x technical interviews

  • 1-hour interview with hiring managers


For Eng Manager roles:

  • CV screening

  • Online coding assessment

  • 2 x technical interviews

  • Leadership/people management assessment

  • 1-hour interview with hiring managers


For other roles: Generally, follows the same format of screening, hands-on assessments, final interview round with hiring managers. Details are provided to all applicants at the point of application

questionListItems.title: What is the level of coding experience expected from a PM at OGP?
questionListItems.body: What are some key competencies (ie can communicate with SWEs on technical details) and coding language proficiencies (ie low/no code, Python) expected?

answer.body: PMs at OGP are expected to be able to independently build simple prototype web-apps in any coding language, and understand the codebase on the product they manage. Beyond fluency in code, they’re also expected to be familiar with their products on a technical level: the role and configuration of software/infrastructure components and tooling, key technical design choices and management of monitoring and analytical tools.

questionListItems.title: What do you look for when hiring new software engineers?
questionListItems.body: I would like to know more about the software engineer role.

answer.body:
In general, we look for people who show strong ability in the field they’re applying for, who care about tech for public good, who are strong communicators, and who take the initiative to make things happen.
We look more at demonstrated experience (e.g. side projects) than academic qualifications or specific degrees.

For software engineers - we work mostly in TypeScript, though we do not require experience in any specific programming language or technology.

We look for people who have a demonstrated ability to build software + who can write code to solve programming problems.
We look for individuals who can not just code, but also take and reason about code with other engineers as well as non-engineers.

questionListItems.title: How long can a successful candidate hold an offer?
questionListItems.body: How long will a successful candidate be given to accept an offer?

answer.body: Our offer deadline is 7 days. That said, the 7 days is just a guideline, and we are happy to provide extensions where necessary.

questionListItems.title: Are coding skills required for the role of Product Operation Specialist?

answer.body:
Coding is not required for the Product Operations Specialist role in OGP.


Although it is not mandatory, having tech-related skills such as coding is advantageous as there is an expectation to comprehend the technical architecture of the product and grasp technical details.


In addition to technical knowledge, what would be advantageous is to share how you have applied your tech skills in both your professional and personal life.

questionListItems.title: What is the time range from offer acceptance to start of work for successful candidates?
questionListItems.body: What would be the earliest and latest start date from the time of offer acceptance for successful candidates?

answer.body: It depends on the urgency of the role, we are generally flexible on this front, and are happy to work out an amenable start date upon offer. We have started candidates within two weeks of offer acceptances, and have also waited three months whilst candidates served out their notice at their previous employment.

questionListItems.title: Can only computer science majors apply for SWE roles?
questionListItems.body: Hi, I do not have formal education in computer science (CS) but have self-learned it and developed some tools. Would I be considered?

answer.body: We are open to candidates from different backgrounds, as long as they are able to meet our technical bar for hiring. We do not screen people out on the basis of major or academic achievement alone, but look more at experience and expertise in the field, e.g. we have hired self taught programmers before as well.

questionListItems.title: If a job posting is removed from the site, does that mean that the position is being filled?

answer.body: Yes, when a job posting is removed from our career page, it could mean that the position has been filled, hiring has been put on pause, or no longer hiring

questionListItems.title: Does OGP provide visa sponsorship for global applicants?

answer.body: Yes, we are able to hire foreigners on Employment Passes.
We don’t have a dress code so come in anything that you’re comfortable in!

questionListItems.title: May I know is the duration of the interviewing and acceptance process for interns?

answer.body:
The total time taken from application to offer acceptance is driven by the assessment stages during recruitment: shortlisting, online assessment, and interviewing.


The length of time taken to be shortlisted varies the most, depending on the number of applications received and currently under assessment.


Should you be shortlisted and subsequently chosen by an intern manager, we will immediately send an online assessment to be done within 14 days. On passing this, we will schedule an interview with your potential manager to take place, ideally within the next 14 days, depending on availability.


A decision will then be made within the next 1-3 weeks, after the interviewer has completed his or her evaluation.
